summary:
Key qualifications: 

Training groups at all levels, from grass roots to university level (diplomats, judges) on a.o. law and specifically human rights law, migration issues, policy analysis and lobby and advocacy

Experience in working in a multi-cultural setting as trainer, lobbyist and organizer/manager

Managing complex projects with project partners in different countries (e.g. Master’s of European law and policy; two partners in two countries and DOVA, domestic violence and human rights; ten partners in 9 countries)

Building and implementing lobby and advocacy strategies at the national, regional and international level (e.g. European Union and United Nations)

Experience and knowledge on building and maintaining national and cross boundary alliances and networks (e.g. Dutch network for the implementation of the convention for the elimination of discrimination of women and Women’s causus for gender justice, advocacy for gender justice in international criminal law)

Knowledge and experience in legal research a, policy analysis research and evaluation

Specialties: Human rights, especially women's human rights; International (criminal) law, Gender; training and teaching

projects:
[{'title': 'Impact Assessment Evaluation of the Human Rights and Good Governance Secretariat in the oPt', 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, 'description': 'Impact assessment evaluation of the Human Rights and Good Governance Secretariat in the oPt managed by NDC. The Human Rights and Good Governance Secretariat was established to pool human rights and good governance funding to the oPt by several donors (Netherlands, Sweden, Switzerland and Denmark).

The Impact Assessment study (IA) reflected the HRGG Secretariat intention to assess the extent to which the Secretariat, funded by donors, had contributed to the promotion and respect of human rights and good governance in the oPt. The assessment analysed to what extent the donor consortium, and therefore the Secretariat, influenced partner NGOs and contributed to an overall change of the HRGG situation in the oPt.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Loeky', 'last_name': 'Droesen', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Independent consultant'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Jan', 'last_name': 'De Vries', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Advies/ Consultancy/ Training/ Programma Management
Advocacy - Beleidsbeïnvloeding - Collectieve Belangenbehartiging 
'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Mervat', 'last_name': 'Rishmawi', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Senior Human Rights Consultant  - Researcher and Policy Analyst  -  Human rights lecturer and trainer - Working globally on themes - Middle East and North Africa Specialist'}]}]
